attractions.name: Coventry Cathedral
attractions.description: The stunning ruins of the old cathedral stand beside the modern new cathedral, a symbol of reconciliation after WWII destruction.

attractions.name: Coventry Transport Museum
attractions.address: Millennium Place, Hales St, Coventry CV1 1JD
attractions.description: Home to the world's largest collection of British road transport, including many vehicles made in Coventry.

attractions.name: St. Mary's Guildhall
attractions.description: One of Britain's finest medieval buildings with over 650 years of history, including being a prison for Mary Queen of Scots.

attractions.name: War Memorial Park
attractions.description: Beautiful 48.5 hectare park featuring memorials, gardens, sports facilities, and hosts major events throughout the year.

attractions.name: Herbert Art Gallery & Museum
attractions.description: Excellent museum showcasing Coventry's history, art, and culture with interactive exhibits for all ages.

attractions.name: Coombe Abbey Park
attractions.description: 500 acres of beautiful historic parkland with lakes, woodland walks, and a medieval abbey, perfect for nature lovers.

attractions.name: Belgrade Theatre
attractions.address: Belgrade Square, Corporation St, Coventry CV1 1GS
attractions.description: Britain's first civic theatre, named in recognition of a gift of timber from Belgrade, offering top-quality productions.

attractions.name: FarGo Village
attractions.description: Creative quarter with independent shops, street food, arts spaces, and regular markets in a revitalized industrial area.
